instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
water damaged board, no major corrosion, ran it through the ultrasonic anyway.
First problem with this board was g3h was 1.8V due to <TRANSISTOR>Q7530</TRANSISTOR> being shorted, after replacing it, g3h is now 12.6 as it should be.
Now i keep going in circles trying to trace down <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, i think i have it down to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> missing, but keep ending up lost or in circles.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7530</TRANSISTOR> shorted and very likely killed the CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i suspected as much. is there something i can do to confirm that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Without putting a good CPU on the board there is no real way. Shorted high side FETs are usually a direct write off for me.
